title: Do old cell phone numbers get retired or reused? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes unfortunately so. Most cell phone companies end up with old landline numbers of landline companies that have closed down. But regardless, I've spent 6 years calling people back that was harassing me for the last owner of my number. Constantly being nice enough to let them know they were blowing up the wrong number. Still 6 years later, many numbers blocked, and yet they still calling her.

off course. Once your number gets deactivated from the contract, the number is put into quarentine for a period of 90 to 120 days (depending on the regulations of the country as well as policies of the company. Once this period is over, the number gets put back into the pool of numbers which can be sold.
Phone numbers no longer is use are re-added to the available pool of numbers.

Yes. Once you relinquish your phone number, either by choosing a new phone number with a new carrier, asking for a phone number change due to harassment or other reasons, will remain in a clearinghouse for 90 days and if not reclaimed will go back into a phone number pool.
